boardgame.name: Bootleggers
私酒年代
boardgame.description: It's January 1921. Prohibition has been in effect for a year, and it looks like the 18th Amendment is here to stay. The problem, however, is that outlawing the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;manufacture, sale, or transportation of intoxicating liquors_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; hasn't done anything to reduce the demand for booze! As a result, illegal stills dot the countryside and secret (or not-so-secret!) speakeasies are popping up all over in cities large and small. Local law enforcement may look the other way (especially if they're properly motivated) but Elliot Ness' G-Men are harder to convince. With this much money at stake, organized crime is sure to take an interest._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In Bootleggers, players take on the role of enterprising bosses seeking to make a name for themselves in the illegal alcohol trade at the height of the 1920's prohibition era. Deceit, lies, and alliances of convenience are the norm as players attempt to control distribution through money and corruption by muscling in on the competition, paying off the local law authorities, building underground speakeasies, and shipping trucks of _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;hooch_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: The Daily Dope from The Gaming Gang: April 5th, 2013
The Daily Dope from The Gaming Gang: April 5th, 2013

Compete against your rivals to sell the most liquor during the Prohibition era. This is the first edition from Eagle Games. Two cards have been misprinted, and corrected by hand. But for those two this game would be in Very Good condition. This game has been adult-owned in a smoke-free, child-free, pet-free household. Played fewer than 5 times. PLEASE CLICK ON MY USERNAME TO SEE MY OTHER SALES - I COMBINE SHIPPING AT 5.00 PER EXTRA GAME. You can also pick up in Chicago at no cost! I sell exclusively through BGG, so buying from me always goes back to the site.

*** 4th Dimension Games *** Bootleggers: $14.00 In Stock (7% sales tax for residents of Pennsylvania) This is a New, Sealed in Box Bootleggers board game. Publisher: Eagles Games Number of Players: 3-6 Ages: 14+ Length: 120 Minutes Shipping: Shipping rates will be determined upon sale or request. Insurance is optional but highly recommended for higher priced items. The shipping costs are NOT inflated. You pay exactly what I am charged for shipping, along with material costs. I ship through FedEx or USPS, whichever is cheaper. Normal shipping costs run from $8.00 - $11.00. Payment: I accept PayPal, money orders, personal and cashier_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s checks. Personal checks will be accepted but I will wait until the check has cleared before sending the item. I will add 3.9% to the price when paying by PayPal. Return Policy: I want you to be completely satisfied with your item. Because of this, I will accept return of any item for a refund of the purchase price within 30 days of the sale. The item must be in the same condition that it was sent. I cannot refund the shipping cost.

SELLERS TERMS AND CONDITIONS: PAYMENT TERMS: Payment is due within 7 days of the date you placed the order. Please do not purchase if you do not intend to pay, or cannot pay within this time frame. PAYMENT METHODS: PayPal SHIPPING: Buyer is responsible for all shipping cost. INSURANCE: Insurance is optional on all items, unless noted. RETURNS: New Unopened items may be returned for a refund of the purchase price of the item, excluding shipping charges, within 7 days of the delivery date. All returned items must be in the original packaging and in the condition that they were shipped to you. Defective or damaged items can be returned for an exchange within 7 days of the delivery date. All returns require authorization BEFORE returning the item. If you refuse delivery of an order, we will deduct the return shipping charge from your refund.

Mayday Games (MYY4307) It is the time of the speakeasy and bath tub gin... It is the time of the BOOTLEGGERS! In Bootleggers, players will find themselves slipping into a very thematic experience as they produce and sell moonshine in the early twentieth century. Using a vast array of plastic gangsters and trucks, players must attempt to use their muscle cards to take the best action cards and control the speakeasies. With treachery, backstabbing, alliances and more, Bootleggers forces players to use their resources wisely. It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s a good thing to produce a lot of moonshine at the distilleries but too much will bring the police down on your business, and hired thugs might steal your trucks or worse! Bootleggers is a combination of good mechanics with a healthy dose of American theme for a fun, rewarding experience.

Condition - New in shrink-wrap. Payment by PayPal in advance or cash on pickup. For shipping this is considered a large size game. The following options are available for delivery within the continental United States: 1) Local pickup in the San Jose, California area (no cost) 2) USPS Priority Mail Flat Rate - $6.60 (small), $12.65 (medium), or $17.15 (large), depending on game size. Generally very small games fit in the small box, small or medium in the medium box, and large in the large box. Box fits for some games are very snug, allowing minimal protective padding - if this shipping option is picked for such games seller assumes no responsibility for damage during transit. 3) USPS Parcel Select Ground / Non-Flat Rate Priority - varies, usually only cheaper than Flat Rate Priority for small and very light weight games (under 2 pounds), an additional fee of $3.25 for the box and packing materials will be added to the shipping costs. 4) FedEx Ground - varies, usually from $12 for short distance shipments of light weight games to $30 for heavy games (or multiple games up to 10 pounds) long distance shipments. This is usually the cheapest option for very large games. An additional fee of $3.25 for the box and packing materials will be added to the shipping costs. While expensive, this is the best method if damage during transit is a concern, as all items will be packed in boxes sufficiently sized for protective materials. Shipping rates to Alaska or Hawaii will be higher for FedEx. Games will not be shipped by any method other than a shipping box, nor unboxed or in less than complete condition, please do not ask.
